posts.name: Kate-signal
posts.cooked:
Today, we‚Äôre releasing version 7.92 to beta. If you‚Äôre interested in participating, join the beta group.

Release notes:

‚Ä¢ We fixed a bug with the emoji selection sheet background color during voice and video calls. Now you don‚Äôt need to search for the rage emoji when a bright background appears during a dark-themed (or thematically mysterious) group call.

‚Ä¢ We also updated and improved the text that appears in various second-person and third-person story reply scenarios. If you can‚Äôt remember what ‚Äúsecond person‚Äù looks like, this sentence is your latest example.

Please continue to report any issues you encounter!

When reporting issues, please include debug logs and screenshots if applicable; if you‚Äôre experiencing a crash, please also include .ips files. Instructions can be found here.

Thank you all, as always, for helping us improve Signal!

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.91 release

posts.cooked:
New Version: 7.92.0.1289-beta

80 new commits since 7.91.0.1278-beta (+ 1 commit omitted):

Show commits

  • Bump version to 7.92 [1]

  • Add internal switch to disable tracking of content underneath the chat header. [2]

  • Modernize media interactive dismiss animation. [3]

  • More pinned message animations [4]

  • Add outgoing device prompt if backup too old [5]

  • Add support for remote mute receive. [6]

  • Remove iOS 26 SDK checks [7]

  • Fix emoji sheet background color during calls (#12851) [8]

  • Handle pinning with remotely deleted messages [9]

  • Remove throws from BackupListMediaStore [10]

  • Use failIfThrows in code downstream of BackupListMediaManager [11]

  • Deprotocolize AttachmentUploadStore, use failIfThrows [12]

  • Rename AttachmentUploadStoreImpl.swift [13]

  • Always update attachment with listed CDN in ListMedia [14]

  • Use failIfThrows in BackupAttachmentUploadStore [15]

  • Remove final throws from BackupAttachmentDownloadStore [16]

  • Deprotocolize AttachmentDownloadStore, use failIfThrows [17]

  • Build fix [18]

  • Use the actual values from the data message to expire pinned message chat events [19]

  • Deprotocolize OrphanedBackupAttachmentStore, use failIfThrows [20]

  • Update backup tests submodule commit to main and add pin message tests [21]

  • Add debug info for fetched subscriptions [22]

  • Move AttachmentStore-adjacent types around [23]

  • Add BackoffStrategy to Retry, with case errorDependent(backoffBlock:) [24]

  • Make CVComponentState a struct [25]

  • Fix race when returning to call view controller [26]

  • Improve KeyValueStore compile-time checks [27]

  • Use NSSecureCoding in LegacySDSSerializer [28]

  • Use NSSecureCoding for waveform files [29]

  • Remove isConversationPreview [30]

  • Include filename in pinned message banner if available [31]

  • Call Quality Survey [32]

  • Remove Promises from attachment downloads [33]

  • Use ConcurrentTaskQueue for attachment downloads [34]

  • Use UInt64 for maxResponseSize [35]

  • Remove redundant image validation checks [36]

  • Use Aci in SessionStoreTest [37]

  • Restrict SystemStoryManagerMock to testable builds [38]

  • Use .mappedIfSafe for link previews & stickers [39]

  • Use UInt64 for attachment size limits [40]

  • Clean up WebP parsing [41]

  • Remove redundant story onboarding image validation [42]

  • Clarify attachment relationships in EditManagerAttachments [43]

  • Remove unused parameters [44]

  • Throw error when failing to serialize a message [45]

  • Update to LibSignal v0.86.11 [46]

  • Move sent transcript sending to the message sender [47]

  • Use performRepeatedly for attachment downloads [48]

  • Pass LocalIdentifiers to methods during sends [49]

  • Adopt NSSecureCoding everywhere [50]

  • Treat all warnings as errors [51]

  • Remove unused NSSecureCoding conformances [52]

  • Swiftify OWSReceiptsForSenderMessage [53]

  • Swiftify OWSOutgoingCallMessage [54]

  • Swiftify OWSStickerPackSyncMessage [55]

  • Swiftify getOrCreateThread [56]

  • Fix flaky pasteboard [57]

  • Don't bump pinned messages to the top of the chat list [58]

  • Back up pending SS changes when app becomes active [59]

  • fix pinned message landscape mode [60]

  • Remove Transifex mentions from TRANSLATING.md [61]

  • Swiftify OWSOutgoingSentMessageTranscript [62]

  • Remove Obj-C database write macros [63]

  • Swiftify OWSOutgoingResendRequest [64]

  • Fix member action sheet on iPad [65]

  • Allow editing group description from conversation settings "more" button [66]

  • Check WebP lengths before decoding [67]

  • Fixes and improvements to profile / group picture viewer. [‚Ä¶] [68]

  • Remove BackupSettings killswitch [69]

  • Fix story-reply strings for 2nd/3rd person [70]

  • Use fixed amount of space for message delivery status indicators. [71]

  • Add remote-config to show Backups megaphone [72]

  • Add build flag for call quality survey [73]

  • Update call quality survey check [74]

  • Validate usernames before exporting them [75]

  • Filter out empty addresses during backup [76]

  • Update call quality survey flag and correct toast corners [77]

  • Improve UX for quoted audio reply previews [78]

  • Update release notes [79]

  • Update translations [80]

Gathered from signalapp/Signal-iOS 7.91.0.1278-beta‚Ä¶7.92.0.1289-beta

posts.cooked: Just a note for everyone that follows these threads that tomorrow (Monday 19 Jan) is a U.S. holiday, so there might not be any development activity.

New Version: 7.92.0.1306-beta

6 new commits since 7.92.0.1289-beta:

  • More judiciously set BackupPlan and side-effects on during restore, from SS [1]

  • Bring back removed Backup attachment fetch optimization [2]

  • Fix string typo [3]

  • When displaying a contact name, also display the profile name [4]

  • Fix pinned messages editing behavior [5]

  • Update translations [6]

link_counts.title: Beta feedback for the upcoming Desktop 7.86 release

posts.name: Whatnoww
posts.cooked:
When swiping between the message details page and the chat I was in, Signal broke its UI.

signal-2026-01-22-2042041290√ó2796 104 KB

https://debuglogs.org/ios/7.92.0/517ab7a98849a6410dd48bd6be1efc3c95b2ce96cbc45ee2c2736f0fbc380700.zip

As you can see, the background is messed up and so is almost every other ui element.

Beta testing for this release has concluded. If you find any further bugs related to this release or earlier releases, please report them on GitHub (read How to Report Bugs for more information on how to do that).

If you have feedback specifically related to the new beta version, please post it in the following topic: Beta feedback for the upcoming iOS 7.93 release.
